revised_title: Elastic Equilibrium of Isotropic Plates and Cylinders: A New Approach
tldr: The authors present a new method for solving the elastic equilibrium of isotropic plates and cylinders, focusing on stress distributions with faces free from applied normal and shear stresses. They use complex variable techniques to simplify the theory and express the stress equations of equilibrium in a more compact form. This approach can be applied to a wider range of problems related to flat plates and cylinders with curved surfaces.
